definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
to manipulate from behind the scenes/to pull the strings
news from behind the scenes/stage gossip
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand

sentences.english: They are brewing a plot behind the scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在幕後策劃一個陰謀。

sentences.english: Dare to look at the facts behind the foods you eat.
sentences.chinese: 你敢去看你喫的食物的幕後事實？

sentences.english: Many people are asking what is behind the Panama papers.
sentences.chinese: 許多人在問巴拿馬文件的幕後動機。

sentences.english: ZTE, by contrast, keeps itself in the background.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，中興公司始終使自己處在幕後的位置。

sentences.english: Put your energy into behind the scenes activities.
sentences.chinese: 將精力投入到幕後活動。

sentences.english: The company behind the scheme is Sunburst Biotechnologies.
sentences.chinese: 幕後的公司是新保思生物科技有限公司。

sentences.english: At the time i had a lawyer on payroll and i hid behind the action.
sentences.chinese: 當時在工資表上我僱有一個律師，我躲在幕後。

sentences.english: There are many things going in the background but almost nothing is reported.
sentences.chinese: 有許多事在幕後進行，但幾乎沒有一件被報導出來。

sentences.english: This means that he appeared from behind a curtain after he had broken free.
sentences.chinese: 這意味他在掙脫後纔會從布幕後出現。
某種類型的溼的幕後故事，耳朵揹包客？

sentences.english: Viewers flocked to the program for its off-screen scandals as well as for the on-screen romance.
sentences.chinese: 不單是節目上的浪漫，幕後的醜聞也吸引着眼球。

sentences.english: Perhaps he is afraid to speak on any topic at all without Dick Cheney pulling his strings.
sentences.chinese: 大概沒有迪克切尼的幕後操縱他害怕談論任何話題。

sentences.english: He commands Paolo to curse the man behind the kidnapping.
sentences.chinese: 他命令保羅詛咒綁架的幕後主使者。

sentences.english: You cannot afford to use underhand business methods.
sentences.chinese: 你不能用幕後的商業手段。

sentences.english: In recent years, he shifted his focus to work behind the scenes.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，馮德倫將工作重點轉移到幕後。

sentences.english: Proscenium , whom do play in backstage?

definition: to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
bunch of gangsters/criminal gang/organized crime syndicate
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
